skill.name: code-reviewer
skill.description: Automated code review with best practices, security checks, and quality standards.
skill.summary: Automated code review with best practices, security checks, and quality standards.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only AI instructions for code review behavior. No network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Review code for quality and security
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides automated, comprehensive code reviews covering quality standards, security vulnerabilities, and best practices across any codebase.
actual_capabilities: Reviews code for readability, naming, and organization
Checks for security vulnerabilities and injection risks
Validates testing coverage and edge case handling
Applies SOLID, DRY, KISS, and YAGNI principles
Provides severity ratings and actionable fix recommendations
limitations: Does not execute or modify code directly
Cannot access external APIs or build systems
Limited to analyzing provided code snippets
Review quality depends on code context provided

use_cases.title: Pre-commit code review
use_cases.description: Review pull requests and code changes before merging to catch issues early

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability scanning
use_cases.description: Identify SQL injection, XSS, and other security risks in codebase

use_cases.title: Code quality assessment
use_cases.description: Evaluate code quality and consistency across team contributions

prompt_templates.title: Basic file review
prompt_templates.prompt: @code-reviewer Review the following code file for quality, security, and best practices:

prompt_templates.title: Security focus
prompt_templates.prompt: @code-reviewer --focus security Review this code for security vulnerabilities:

prompt_templates.title: Critical issues
prompt_templates.prompt: @code-reviewer --severity critical List only critical issues that must be fixed immediately.

prompt_templates.title: Full directory audit
prompt_templates.prompt: @code-reviewer src/auth/ Review all files in this directory for security, quality, and best practices.

output_examples.input: @code-reviewer Review this code for security issues: const query = `SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = '${email}'`;
output: Critical Issue: SQL Injection Vulnerability - Raw string concatenation allows attackers to manipulate queries
Impact: Attackers could access or modify database
Fix: Use parameterized queries with prepared statements

best_practices: Provide full file context rather than isolated snippets for more accurate analysis
Specify focus areas like security, performance, or style when you have specific concerns
Use severity flags to filter output when reviewing large codebases
anti_patterns: Providing only error messages without surrounding code context
Skipping security reviews to save time on new code
Ignoring minor issues that compound into technical debt over time

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Any programming language. Review instructions are language-agnostic and apply general best practices.

faq.question: How many lines can it review at once?
faq.answer: Review scope depends on your AI context limit. Smaller files provide more thorough analysis.

faq.question: Does it integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The skill works with any AI tool. CI/CD integration requires additional tooling configuration.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. Code is only processed by your AI tool and not stored externally.

faq.question: Why did I get different results than a linter?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes patterns and logic that static linters may miss, including architectural and design concerns.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Copilot or other AI tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured code reviews with severity ratings. It complements AI coding assistants with focused review capabilities.
